br.uff.midiacom.ana.region
Class NCLRegionBase<T extends NCLElement,Er extends NCLRegion,Ei extends NCLImportBase,R extends ExternalReferenceType>

All Implemented Interfaces:
NCLElement<T>, XMLElement<T>
public class NCLRegionBase<T extends NCLElement,Er extends NCLRegion,Ei extends NCLImportBase,R extends ExternalReferenceType>
extends NCLBase<T,Ei>

Class that represents a base of regions.
This element defines the attributes:

  • id - id of the base of regions. This attribute is optional.
  • device - class of devices that use the base of regions. This attribute is optional.
  • region - region to be used as parent of the regions defined in the base of regions. This attribute is optional. See the reference (ABNT NBR 15606-2) to more information.

This element has as children the elements:
  • importBase - element that imports a region base defined in another NCL document. The base can have none or several import elements.
  • region - element representing a region inside the base. The base can have none or several region elements.
Note that the base of regions must have at least one child element, which can be a import or a region.

setDevice

public void setDevice(NCLDevice device)
               throws XMLException
Sets the class of devices that use the base of regions. This attribute is optional. Set the device to null to erase a device already defined.
The possible device values are defined in the enumeration NCLDevice.

Parameters:
device - element from enumeration NCLDevice representing the class of devices that use the base of regions or null to erase the device already defined.
Throws:
XMLException - if an error occur while notifying the modification.

getDevice

public NCLDevice getDevice()

Returns:
element from enumeration NCLDevice representing the class of devices that use the base of regions or null if the attribute is not defined.

setParentRegion

public void setParentRegion(java.lang.Object region)
                     throws XMLException
Sets the region to be used as parent of the regions defined in the base of regions. This attribute is optional. Set the region to null to erase a region already defined. This attribute must refer to a region defined in a base of regions of an active class. See the reference (ABNT NBR 15606-2) to more information.

Parameters:
region - element representing a reference to a region or null to erase a region already defined.
Throws:
XMLException - if any error occur while creating the reference to the region.

getParentRegion

public java.lang.Object getParentRegion()
Returns the region to be used as parent of the regions defined in the base of regions or null if the attribute is not defined. This attribute must refer to a region defined in a base of regions of an active class. See the reference (ABNT NBR 15606-2) to more information.

Returns:
element representing a reference to a region or null if the attribute is not defined.
